steps.situation: ASA451 (KSEA) contacts you: 'Seattle Departure, Alaska 451, climbing 4,000 feet, SUMDI 3 departure.'

options.response: Alaska 451, Seattle Departure, radar contact. Climb and maintain Flight Level 230.

steps.situation: ASA451: 'Departure, Alaska 451, we're showing max performance, unable to meet the 5.8% gradient for the SUMDI departure.'

options.response: Alaska 451, roger. Turn right heading 030, radar vectors, maintain 7,000. Be advised of mountainous terrain.
Alaska 451, roger, advise when able to meet gradient.
Alaska 451, you must comply with the SID gradient.

steps.situation: ASA451 is on heading 030, climbing 7,000. You must get them back on course or hand them off.

options.response: Alaska 451, clear of terrain. Resume SUMDI departure, climb and maintain Flight Level 230.

steps.situation: ASA451 is re-established on the SID, passing FL180.
DLH456 (EDDM) contacts you: 'München Departure, Lufthansa 456, climbing 5,000 feet, KUNGA 2D departure.'

options.response: Lufthansa 456, München Departure, radar contact. Climb and maintain Flight Level 240.

steps.situation: DLH456: 'Departure, Lufthansa 456, request to delete speed restriction, high speed.' The SID has a 'MAX 220 knots' restriction until 10,000 feet.

options.response: Lufthansa 456, unable high speed, maintain max 220 knots until 10,000 feet.

steps.situation: DLH456 is now passing 9,000 feet, and you observe their ground speed increasing, indicating an airspeed above 220 knots.

options.response: Lufthansa 456, verify speed, maintain max 220 knots until 10,000 feet.
Lufthansa 456, you are violating the speed restriction, report to the authorities.

steps.situation: DLH456 has complied, passed 10,000 feet, and is now climbing through FL210.
EKA007 (OMDB) contacts you: 'Dubai Departure, Emirates 007, climbing 7,000 feet, BOKMI 2A departure.'

options.response: Emirates 007, Dubai Departure, radar contact. Climb and maintain Flight Level 200.
Emirates 007, Dubai Departure, radar contact. Stop climb 7,000.

steps.situation: EKA007: 'Departure, Emirates 007, request 30 degrees right for weather.' Your radar shows a significant cell on their track.

options.response: Emirates 007, deviation 30 degrees right approved, advise when able to resume navigation.

steps.situation: EKA007 is now clear of the weather. EKA007: 'Departure, Emirates 007, clear of weather, request direct BOKMI.'

options.response: Emirates 007, cleared direct BOKMI, resume SID.

steps.situation: EKA007 is proceeding direct BOKMI, climbing through FL170.
TAM301 (SBGR) contacts you: 'São Paulo Departure, TAM 301, climbing 7,000 feet, EKPOD 2A departure.'

options.response: TAM 301, São Paulo Departure, radar contact. Climb and maintain Flight Level 190.

steps.situation: Due to traffic, you need to amend the SID. You: 'TAM 301, amend SID, fly the EKPOD 2B departure.' TAM301 replies: 'Fly the EKPOD 2C departure, TAM 301.'

options.response: Negative, TAM 301. I repeat, fly the EKPOD 2 B (Bravo) departure.
TAM 301, that is incorrect. Fly the EKPOD 2B.

steps.situation: TAM301 correctly reads back 'EKPOD 2 Bravo'. The aircraft begins the turn for the new track.

options.response: TAM 301, readback correct. Continue climb Flight Level 190.

steps.situation: TAM301 is now established on the EKPOD 2B track, climbing through FL160.
DAL123 (KSEA) checks in: 'Seattle Departure, Delta 123, climbing 6,000, JEFFA 4 departure.'

options.response: Delta 123, Seattle Departure, radar contact. Climb and maintain 12,000.

steps.situation: DAL123: 'Departure, Delta 123, we're painting weather 10 miles ahead, request 15 degrees left to deviate.' This deviation heads towards Mount Rainier (14,411 ft).

options.response: Delta 123, unable deviation left due to terrain. Can you accept a deviation 20 degrees right?
Delta 123, maintain SID, weather is not significant.
Delta 123, deviation 15 degrees left approved, advise when clear.

steps.situation: DAL123: 'Affirm, 20 degrees right is acceptable, Delta 123.'

options.response: Delta 123, deviation 20 degrees right approved. Report when able to resume JEFFA departure.

steps.situation: DAL123 is clear of weather, back on the SID, and climbing through 11,000 feet.

options.response: Delta 123, climb and maintain Flight Level 230, contact Seattle Center 128.55.

steps.situation: BAW987 (EDDM) contacts you: 'München Departure, Speedbird 987, climbing 4,000 feet, RILAX 3D.'

options.response: Speedbird 987, München Departure, radar contact. Climb and maintain Flight Level 220.

steps.situation: BAW987 is heavy and climbing slowly. They are approaching the edge of your sector (FL200) but are only at FL170.

options.response: Speedbird 987, continue climb Flight Level 220, report passing Flight Level 190.

steps.situation: BAW987: 'Reporting Flight Level 190, Speedbird 987.' They are now 2 miles from the boundary.

options.response: Speedbird 987, roger. Contact München Control on 132.8.

steps.situation: München Control calls you: 'München Control, BAW987 is still on your frequency?'

options.response: (Acknowledge error) München Control, roger, handoff is approved, my apologies.
München Control, I am still working them.
München Control, tell them to contact me.
München Control, I already handed them off.

steps.situation: QTR123 (OMDB) checks in: 'Dubai Departure, Qatar 123, climbing 5,000, NIPDA 1A departure.'

options.response: Qatar 123, Dubai Departure, radar contact. Climb and maintain Flight Level 190.

steps.situation: The NIPDA 1A departure has a speed restriction of 'MAX 210 knots' until 8,000 feet. You observe QTR123's speed at 240 knots, passing 6,000 feet.

options.response: Qatar 123, verify speed. Maintain max 210 knots until 8,000 feet per the SID.

steps.situation: QTR123: 'Apologies, Departure. Slowing to 210 knots, Qatar 123.' The aircraft reduces speed.

options.response: Qatar 123, roger. Continue climb Flight Level 190.

steps.situation: QTR123 is past 8,000 feet, speed 250 knots, climbing through FL160.
GOL789 (SBGR) contacts you: 'São Paulo Departure, GOL 789, climbing 8,000, BITLA 1A departure.'

options.response: GOL 789, São Paulo Departure, radar contact. Climb and maintain Flight Level 210.

steps.situation: GOL789: 'Departure, GOL 789, unable to meet the 6.2% gradient on the BITLA departure due to performance.' SBGR is high elevation and surrounded by terrain.

options.response: GOL 789, roger. Maintain 8,000, turn left heading 270, radar vectors for terrain.
GOL 789, you must comply with the SID.

steps.situation: GOL789 is on heading 270, clear of the immediate terrain. GOL789: 'Departure, GOL 789, we are now able to resume climb.'

options.response: GOL 789, roger. Proceed direct BITLA, resume SID, climb and maintain Flight Level 210.

steps.situation: GOL789 is re-established, climbing through FL180.
UAL550 (KSEA) checks in: 'Seattle Departure, United 550, climbing 5,000, SUMDI 3 departure.'

options.response: United 550, Seattle Departure, radar contact. Climb and maintain 12,000.

steps.situation: You have faster traffic (DAL123) overtaking UAL550. Both are on the SUMDI SID. You need to create space.
DAL123 has passed UAL550. UAL550 is now at 210 knots.

options.response: United 550, resume normal speed, climb and maintain Flight Level 230.

steps.situation: UAL550 is climbing through FL200.
AFR221 (EDDM) contacts you: 'München Departure, Air France 221, 6,000 feet, KUNGA 2D.'

options.response: Air France 221, München Departure, radar contact. Climb and maintain Flight Level 240.

steps.situation: München Control requests you re-route AFR221 due to military activity. You need to switch them to the RILAX SID.

options.response: Air France 221, amend SID. Stop climb 7,000. Turn right heading 090, radar vectors, expect RILAX 3D departure.
Air France 221, amend SID, fly RILAX 3D.

steps.situation: AFR221 is on heading 090. You need to get them established on the new SID.

options.response: Air France 221, cleared direct RILAX, resume RILAX 3D departure. Climb and maintain Flight Level 240.

steps.situation: AFR221 is established on the RILAX SID, climbing through FL200.

options.response: Air France 221, contact München Control on 132.8.

steps.situation: SIA330 (OMDB) contacts you: 'Dubai Departure, Singapore 330, climbing 7,000, BOKMI 2A.'

options.response: Singapore 330, Dubai Departure, radar contact. Climb and maintain Flight Level 190.

steps.situation: SIA330 is climbing through FL160. You: 'Singapore 330, contact Emirates Control on 125.45.' SIA330 replies: 'Contacting Center 125.45, but our cleared level is Flight Level 190, we are at Flight Level 160. Confirm handoff?'

options.response: Singapore 330, correction. Maintain this frequency, report passing Flight Level 180.

steps.situation: SIA330: 'Passing Flight Level 180, Singapore 330.'

options.response: Singapore 330, roger. Contact Emirates Control on 125.45.

steps.situation: Emirates Control calls you: 'Departure, SIA330 handoff was early.'

options.response: Emirates Control, apologies, acknowledged. I recalled them and handed off at FL180.
Emirates Control, they were at the correct altitude.

steps.situation: AZU456 (SBGR) contacts you: 'São Paulo Departure, Azul 456, climbing 7,000, EKPOD 2A.' A large weather system is on the SID track.

options.response: Azul 456, São Paulo Departure, radar contact. Climb and maintain Flight Level 200. Be advised, weather on track 20 miles ahead.

steps.situation: AZU456: 'Departure, Azul 456, request 20 degrees left for weather.' Simultaneously, TAM301 (also on frequency) requests '30 degrees right for weather.'

options.response: Azul 456, deviation 20 degrees left approved. TAM301, standby. ... TAM301, deviation 30 degrees right approved. Advise when clear.
Azul 456, unable. TAM301, unable. Maintain SID.
Azul 456, turn left heading 300. TAM301, turn right heading 040.

steps.situation: AZU456: 'Azul 456, clear of weather, request direct EKPOD.'

options.response: Azul 456, cleared direct EKPOD, resume SID.

steps.situation: AZU456 is re-established, climbing through FL180.
SWA678 (KSEA) checks in: 'Seattle Departure, Southwest 678, climbing 4,000, JEFFA 4 departure.'

options.response: Southwest 678, Seattle Departure, radar contact. Climb and maintain Flight Level 230.

steps.situation: SWA678 is climbing through FL200. You: 'Southwest 678, contact Seattle Center on 133.9.' (This is the North sector; JEFFA goes to the South sector).

options.response: (Self-correction) Correction, Southwest 678, contact Seattle Center on 128.55.

steps.situation: SWA678 calls back: 'Departure, Southwest 678, Center says we are on the wrong frequency, advise?'

options.response: Southwest 678, roger. Apologies. Contact Seattle Center on 128.55.
Southwest 678, return to this frequency, maintain FL200.

steps.situation: You must coordinate the error with the North sector controller (133.9).

options.response: (Call 133.9) 'Center, Departure, apologies for the bad handoff on Southwest 678, I've re-routed them to 128.55.'
(Do nothing, assume the pilot fixed it).

steps.situation: RYR199 (EDDM) checks in: 'München Departure, Ryanair 199, 5,000 feet, RILAX 3D.'

options.response: Ryanair 199, München Departure, radar contact. Climb and maintain Flight Level 220.

steps.situation: RYR199: 'Departure, Ryanair 199, unable to meet the noise abatement gradient for RILAX 3D.'

options.response: Ryanair 199, roger. Maintain 6,000. Turn left heading 040, radar vectors, advise when able to resume normal climb.
Ryanair 199, noise abatement gradient is mandatory.

steps.situation: RYR199 is on heading 040, clear of noise-sensitive areas. RYR199: 'Departure, Ryanair 199, able to resume climb.'

options.response: Ryanair 199, roger. Proceed direct RILAX, resume SID, climb and maintain Flight Level 220.

steps.situation: RYR199 is re-established, climbing FL190.
THY123 (OMDB) contacts you: 'Dubai Departure, Turkish 123, climbing 4,000 feet, NIPDA 1A departure.'

options.response: Turkish 123, Dubai Departure, radar contact. Climb and maintain Flight Level 190.

steps.situation: You need to change their transition. You: 'Turkish 123, amend SID, fly the NIPDA 1B (Bravo) departure.' THY123 replies: 'NIPDA 1A departure, Turkish 123.'

options.response: Negative, Turkish 123. I repeat, fly the NIPDA 1 B (Bravo) departure.

steps.situation: THY123: 'Apologies, fly the NIPDA 1 Bravo departure, Turkish 123.' The aircraft begins the turn for the new transition.

options.response: Turkish 123, readback correct. Continue climb Flight Level 190.

steps.situation: THY123 is established on the NIPDA 1B, climbing through FL170.
